critique: This is an executive order from 1936 that exempts a specific person from mandatory retirement. It is difficult to assess its position on the traditional left-right political spectrum. It does not relate to immigration. It allows the executive branch to make exceptions to existing rules, thus expanding executive power. It does not relate to federalism. It does not relate to national security or civil liberties. It does not relate to economic regulation. It does not relate to social inclusion.
